main event: Multiple sightings of unconventional aircraft were reported in New Mexico in November 1948. A bright white ball was observed on two separate occasions, displaying unusual vertical movement and bursting at low altitudes.
interesting points: The unconventional aircraft sightings were reported by an Army Colonel in New Mexico.
The bright white ball displayed vertical movement before bursting at low altitudes.
The witness did not report the incidents initially, assuming they might have been connected with Air Force exercises.
The sightings occurred at different locations in New Mexico, approximately two miles east of Vaughn and 10 miles west of Vaughn.
The report emphasizes the reliability of the information received for individual paragraph evaluation.
location: 10 mi. E Vaughn, N. M. and 10 miles west of Vaughn, New Mexico
